[QUOTE]Plot Keywords:
Disturbing | Female Nudity | Crucifixion | Cannibalism | Bizarre[/QUOTE]

[IMG]http://i277.photobucket.com/albums/kk75/otr2damascus/630322305201LZZZZZZZ.jpg[/IMG]

[QUOTE]The travelling sideshow &#039;Lady Divine&#039;s Cavalcade of Perversions&#039; is actually a front for a group of psychotic kidnappers, with Lady Divine herself the most vicious and depraved of all - but her life changes after she gets raped by a fifteen-foot lobster...  [/QUOTE]

[IMG]http://i277.photobucket.com/albums/kk75/otr2damascus/11-3.png[/IMG]

[IMG]http://i277.photobucket.com/albums/kk75/otr2damascus/22-3.png[/IMG]

[IMG]http://i277.photobucket.com/albums/kk75/otr2damascus/33-2.png[/IMG]

[IMG]http://i277.photobucket.com/albums/kk75/otr2damascus/44-3.png[/IMG]

[IMG]http://i277.photobucket.com/albums/kk75/otr2damascus/55-3.png[/IMG]

[IMG]http://i277.photobucket.com/albums/kk75/otr2damascus/66-3.png[/IMG]

[QUOTE]I love the grainy, inky black and white look of this movie, the bad cuts and scratches and even all the jumps in sound. It&#039;s just so gorgeous and couldn&#039;t be duplicated today...just a strange feeling is captured here, amplified because it&#039;s populated with so many hedonistic weirdos and perverts. Of course, these slight perks only exist because Waters and his crew were completely inept in the technical ways of cinema.

Content wise...this has at least a flash or two of brilliance, which is impressive for a film that cost around "5000" bucks. The opening at the Calvacade of Perversions is great ("She&#039;s not a tramp. She&#039;s an auto-erotica copraphrasiac and a gerontophiliac!"), but I don&#039;t know what to make out of all the dated cultural references (too much Manson/Tate stuff)...then there&#039;s an incredibly tedious and overlong delusion with Divine narrating her version of Christ. Even more time is padded with endless scenes of characters sitting and/or lying in bed talking (and often forgetting their lines), plus topless gitterbugging from Cookie Mueller, people riding around in cars and Mink Stole ("the religious whore") and Divine walking down the street.

Despite all that, the closing sequences (starting with Lobstra) make up for it and are just priceless. Best use of the song "God Bless America" here! And the film is still unique and original 30+ years later, so I give it credit for that.[/QUOTE]
